pr_title: 9214 Warn user about javaee and jakartaee feature compatibility conflicts

timeline.message: 9214 Warn user about javaee and jakartaee compatibility conflicts
9214 Warn user about javaee and jakartaee compatibility conflicts
9214 Warn user about javaee and jakartaee compatibility conflicts

timeline.bodyText:
change
The configured feature {2} of {0}
to
The configured {2} feature of the {0} EE platform
change
the configured feature {3} of {1}
to
the configured {2} feature of the {0} EE platform
change
of {4} features
to
of {4} EE platform features
change
Update server.xml to remove the incompatible features.
to
Update the server.xml file to remove the incompatible features.
timeline.author: jantley-ibm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -200,12 +200,22 @@ UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR=CWWKF0041E: The {0} feature on
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.explanation=The configured feature does not support the specified process type.
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.useraction=Remove the feature from the configuration or change the feature manifest file to enable support for the desired process type.
 
-# CWWK042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
-UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot  be found for the  {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0},  to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1},  to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+# CWWK0042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
+UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot be found for the {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0}, to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1}, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.explanation=The feature manager could not find a definition for the specified feature.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.useraction=Check that the name of the specified feature is spelled correctly.  \
-Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory. If the feature does not exist,  try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name,  to install the feature \
-or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration. 
+Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory.  If the feature does not exist, try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name, to install the feature \
+or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+
+# CWWK0043E  {0} = EePlatform1: {1} = Eeplatform2: {2} = configuredFeature1: {3} = configuredFeature2: {4} shared EePlaform 
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0043E: The configured feature {2} of {0} is incompatible with the configured feature {3} of {1}.  The configuration includes an incompatible combination of {4} features and is not supported.  Update server.xml to remove the incompatible features.

replies.bodyText: As agreed I changed the term "platform" to "programming model".  The messages now indicate "Java EE " and "Jakarta EE " as programming models, but not for every appearance within the message.  The intent is that messages resemble statements in product documentation.  References to server.xml are changed to "the server.xml file" or the server configuration.
replies.author: dazavala

change
in the server configuration. Or, if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.
to

timeline.author: jantley-ibm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -200,12 +200,22 @@ UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR=CWWKF0041E: The {0} feature on
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.explanation=The configured feature does not support the specified process type.
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.useraction=Remove the feature from the configuration or change the feature manifest file to enable support for the desired process type.
 
-# CWWK042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
-UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot  be found for the  {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0},  to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1},  to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+# CWWK0042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
+UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot be found for the {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0}, to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1}, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.explanation=The feature manager could not find a definition for the specified feature.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.useraction=Check that the name of the specified feature is spelled correctly.  \
-Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory. If the feature does not exist,  try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name,  to install the feature \
-or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration. 
+Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory.  If the feature does not exist, try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name, to install the feature \
+or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+
+# CWWK0043E  {0} = EePlatform1: {1} = Eeplatform2: {2} = configuredFeature1: {3} = configuredFeature2: {4} shared EePlaform 
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0043E: The configured feature {2} of {0} is incompatible with the configured feature {3} of {1}.  The configuration includes an incompatible combination of {4} features and is not supported.  Update server.xml to remove the incompatible features.
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR.explanation=The server configuration contains an incompatible combination of features that support the Jakarta EE or Java EE programming models. This conflict can happen if the two incompatible features are configured directly in the server configuration. Or, if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.

timeline.bodyText:
change
the server.xml
to
the server.xml file
(two instances)
change
specifies features supporting Jakarta EE 9 or Java EE, but not both.
to
specifies features that support Jakarta EE 9 or Java EE, but not both.
timeline.author: jantley-ibm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -200,12 +200,22 @@ UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR=CWWKF0041E: The {0} feature on
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.explanation=The configured feature does not support the specified process type.
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.useraction=Remove the feature from the configuration or change the feature manifest file to enable support for the desired process type.
 
-# CWWK042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
-UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot  be found for the  {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0},  to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1},  to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+# CWWK0042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
+UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot be found for the {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0}, to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1}, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.explanation=The feature manager could not find a definition for the specified feature.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.useraction=Check that the name of the specified feature is spelled correctly.  \
-Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory. If the feature does not exist,  try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name,  to install the feature \
-or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration. 
+Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory.  If the feature does not exist, try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name, to install the feature \
+or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+
+# CWWK0043E  {0} = EePlatform1: {1} = Eeplatform2: {2} = configuredFeature1: {3} = configuredFeature2: {4} shared EePlaform 
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0043E: The configured feature {2} of {0} is incompatible with the configured feature {3} of {1}.  The configuration includes an incompatible combination of {4} features and is not supported.  Update server.xml to remove the incompatible features.
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR.explanation=The server configuration contains an incompatible combination of features that support the Jakarta EE or Java EE programming models. This conflict can happen if the two incompatible features are configured directly in the server configuration. Or, if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR.useraction=Try to specify a compatible version of the configured features that caused the conflict in the server.xml.  If no other versions are available, then the configured features are incompatible with each other and cannot be configured at the same time.  Features that support the Jakarta EE 9 programming model are incompatible with features that support Java EE.  If the error indicates Jakarta EE 9, then ensure that the server.xml specifies features supporting Jakarta EE 9 or Java EE, but not both.

@@ -200,12 +200,22 @@ UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR=CWWKF0041E: The {0} feature on
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.explanation=The configured feature does not support the specified process type.
 UPDATE_WRONG_PROCESS_TYPE_DEPENDENCY_CLIENT_ERROR.useraction=Remove the feature from the configuration or change the feature manifest file to enable support for the desired process type.
 
-# CWWK042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name

Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1},  to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+# CWWK0042E  {0} = feature Name: {1} = server name 
+UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR=CWWKF0042E: A feature definition cannot be found for the {0} feature.  Try running the command, bin/installUtility install {0}, to install the feature. Alternatively, you can run the command, bin/installUtility install {1}, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.explanation=The feature manager could not find a definition for the specified feature.
 UPDATE_MISSING_CORE_FEATURE_ERROR.useraction=Check that the name of the specified feature is spelled correctly.  \
-Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory. If the feature does not exist,  try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name,  to install the feature \
-or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration. 
+Also verify that the feature definition exists and is readable in the lib/features directory.  If the feature does not exist, try running the command, bin/installUtility install feature_name, to install the feature \
+or try running the command, bin/installUtility install server_name, to install all features that are referenced by this configuration.
+
+# CWWK0043E  {0} = EePlatform1: {1} = Eeplatform2: {2} = configuredFeature1: {3} = configuredFeature2: {4} shared EePlaform 
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0043E: The configured feature {2} of {0} is incompatible with the configured feature {3} of {1}.  The configuration includes an incompatible combination of {4} features and is not supported.  Update server.xml to remove the incompatible features.
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR.explanation=The server configuration contains an incompatible combination of features that support the Jakarta EE or Java EE programming models. This conflict can happen if the two incompatible features are configured directly in the server configuration. Or, if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_SAME_PLATFORM_ERROR.useraction=Try to specify a compatible version of the configured features that caused the conflict in the server.xml.  If no other versions are available, then the configured features are incompatible with each other and cannot be configured at the same time.  Features that support the Jakarta EE 9 programming model are incompatible with features that support Java EE.  If the error indicates Jakarta EE 9, then ensure that the server.xml specifies features supporting Jakarta EE 9 or Java EE, but not both.
+
+# CWWK0044E  {0} = EePlatform1: {1} = EePlatform2: {2} = ignoredEeFeature1: {3} = ignoredEeFeature2: {4} = configuredFeature1: {5} configuredFeature2
+UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_DIFFERENT_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0044E: The features {2} and {3} cannot be loaded at the same time. The feature {2} of {0} is incompatible with the feature {3} of {1}.  Configured features {4} and {5} include an incompatible combination of features.  Your configuration is not supported.  Update server.xml to use features that support either the Jakarta EE or Java EE programming models, but not both.
